title: Is self-publishing a book on Amazon anonymous? If not, who will know the author's identity? - Quora

response.answer_text: When self-publishing, you fill out things like Author Name, Title, etc. You can put whatever you like as the Author Name, even if it bears no resemblance to your own. Writing under a pseudonym or first initial has vast historical precedent, and is a lot more common than you’d think. I write mostly for a general audience, predominantly fantasy, using my own name. (Natasja Rose) I write adult fiction under a Pseudonym, because I don’t want the two very different types of writing associated with each other. (Other Name) You will need to give your real name and details when filling out the financial information, but the only people who will have access to the are the ones in charge of royalty distribution.

Yes, there are some states (last time I checked, Nevada was one of them) that allow you to set-up LLC (limited liability corporations) and keep the owner’s name anonymous. This will cost you some money. It is possible to do it yourself but there are still filings with the state that are required. You’ll probably also have to hire an agent in the state where you would be served if someone sues the company. The contract with that agent can mandate privacy of identity. Then, file with the IRS for a TIN (tax ID number). Once you have those in hand, sign-up on CreateSpace as a publishing company. Use a pen name that no one but you knows and have your royalties paid to the LLC. Unless you tell someone you wrote it no one will know. You have options for book promotion because the company can hire people to do PR, etc. I am not an attorney but I have set up a number of LLC’s. My knowledge of Nevada’s rules is from ‘10. Good luck.
